intro: Phaca vallicola, commonly known as the valley phaca, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are small and clustered in a rounded head. Phaca vallicola is often found in mountainous regions and is adapted to withstand dry conditions.
